Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Key observations from the log 1 CommunityGroup Some applications have a CommunityGroup eg Highland Civic Darts Club and some have None 2 LocalResident This is a boolean TRUE FALSE In the log we see both TRUE and FALSE 3 PreliminaryScore The initial score given 4 ScoreAdjustment Some entries have adjustments eg +10 Community and others have 0 or NA 5 ManualReview every case has a ManualReview activity with a reviewer assigned

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: But note The adjustment +10 Community only appears for cases that have a CommunityGroup C001 C004 and for which LocalResident is TRUE Cases without a CommunityGroup C002 C003 C005 have adjustment 0 or NA Specifically C001 PreliminaryScoring row has adjustment +10 Community C002 0 C003 0 C004 +10 Community C005 0

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The adjustment +10 Community is given only to applicants who are part of a community group and also LocalResident is TRUE This adjustment increases their score

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: C001 Without the adjustment the PreliminaryScore was 710 then adjusted by +10 to 720 Then approved C004 Without the adjustment 690 then adjusted by +10 to 700 Then approved C002 Score 720 no adjustment approved C003 Score 715 no adjustment rejected C005 Score 740 no adjustment approved

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: So it seems that without adjustment the threshold might be around 720 But we cannot be sure because there might be other factors

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Implications 1 Unfair advantage for community members The adjustment of +10 for community members can make the difference between approval and rejection 2 Geographic bias The adjustment is only given to local residents 3 Equity issue The adjustment is based on factors that are not directly related to creditworthiness Being part of a community group and being a local resident might be correlated with socioeconomic status race or other factors 4 Transparency and justification The adjustment is labeled as Community but the exact criteria is not clear 5 Impact on decisions The adjustment can change the outcome
